definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: You did it because you understand the enormity of the task that lies on.
sentences.chinese: 你这样做，是因为你真切任务的艰巨性是摆在面前。

sentences.english: The implications of some of these questions are stunning in their enormity.
sentences.chinese: 这些问题的部分影响，在于其艰巨性。

sentences.english: They underestimated the difficulty of the task.
sentences.chinese: 他们低估了任务的艰巨性。

sentences.english: The difficulty of the task is no excuse for avoiding it.
sentences.chinese: 这项任务的艰巨性不能成为逃避它的借口。

sentences.english: You did it because understand the enormity of the task that lies ahead.
sentences.chinese: 你这样做，是因为你明白任务的艰巨性是摆在面前。

sentences.english: He convinced me of the difficulty of the work.
sentences.chinese: 他使我确信这件工作的艰巨性。

sentences.english: It is necessary to have a profound understanding of the long-term, tough and complex nature of the work against corruption.
sentences.chinese: 要深刻认识反腐工作白勺长期性，艰巨性和复杂性。

sentences.english: The anti-poverty is a long-term and arduous struggle that demands the introduction of legal mechanism.
sentences.chinese: 反贫困斗争的长期性和艰巨性要求法律机制的介入。

definition: with the same idea in mind/with a common purpose
an overall plan taking into account all factors
to tackle a thorny problem and overcome its challenges
in grave difficulties/the situation is grim
a heavy load and a long road/fig. to bear heavy responsibilities through a long struggle (cf Confucian Analects, 8.7)
